reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Identity Data, Contact Data, Financial Data, Transaction Data, Technical Data, Profile Data, Usage Data, and Marketing and Communications Data.

content: Identity Data (e.g. name, date of birth)
Contact Data (e.g. email address, telephone numbers)
Technical Data (e.g. IP address, browser information)
Marketing and Communications Data (e.g. marketing preferences)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy lists various types of personal data that the app collects, including Identity Data, Contact Data, Financial Data, Transaction Data, Technical Data, Profile Data, Usage Data, and Marketing and Communications Data.
reply.reference: The app collects Identity Data, Contact Data, Financial Data, Transaction Data, Technical Data, Profile Data, Usage Data, and Marketing and Communications Data. URL: https://complete-coherence.com/privacy-policy/

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, users can opt out of data collection by asking the company to stop sending marketing messages. Additionally, users can request the deletion or removal of personal data in specific circumstances.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that users can opt out of data collection for marketing messages and request the deletion or removal of personal data in certain scenarios. This confirms that users have the option to control their data collection and deletion.
reply.reference: You can ask us or third parties to stop sending you marketing messages at any time by following the opt-out links on any marketing message sent to you or by contacting us at any time... You also have the right to ask us to delete or remove personal data where there is no good reason for us continuing to process it... URL: https://complete-coherence.com/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal data may be shared with internal and external third parties, as well as in the event of a business transfer or acquisition.
reply.reference:
We may have to share your personal data with the parties set out below for the purposes set out in the table in paragraph 4 above.

- External Third Parties as set out in the Glossary.
